channel.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
channel.description:
Hello everybody.
Last saturday I woke up at 4am and after that we drove about 500 km to north to buy a new bike. :) The whole journey was about 1100 km and it took pretty many hours (we left at 6am and got back 10pm...). The bike I bought was Kawasaki KDX 125 and it cost me 700 euros (pretty cheap), but it looks very bad. Last owner haven't done anything to it, he was just riding it, not taking care of it.
Well anyways, I'm going to make this bike look cool. First I will dissemble it and then I'm going to paint the frame. I also have to buy some new parts to it, and it will take about 400 euros. I'm thinking of buying supermoto rims, but it would cost like 700 euros more, so I'm still considering it. :)
I'm gonna keep posting some pictures in this thread, it's kinda like diary about my bike. :)
Let's get this shit started:
[B][U]6.10.2007[/U][/B]
The day I bought it. Here is the first picture of how it looks like: [url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva246818] [img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/vasensivu.JPG[/img][/url] As you can see, it's very dirty and kinda ugly. Just look at the amount of oil on top of engine... How can someone even let this happen? I got back at 10pm so I didn't have any time to start fixing it.
[U][B]7.10.2007[/B][/U]
Repairing & cleaning begins. Today I decided to clean the bike first... It took some chemicals and rubbing, but it was worth of it as you can see here Before: [url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva246818] [img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/vasensivu.JPG[/img][/url][url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva246821][img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/kone.JPG[/img][/url] After: [url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva246819] [img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/vasensivuj_lkeen.JPG[/img][/url][url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva246820][img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/konej_lkeen1.JPG[/img][/url] Look at the amount of dirt & oil that is gone, you can actually see the engine! :eek: :D After I washed it I started dissembling it for painting, it took rest of my day and here you can see the results: [url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva246930] [img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/runko2.JPG[/img][/url][url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva246929][img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/mylly.JPG[/img][/url]
[u][b]8.10.2007[/b][/u]
Didn't have much time so I only cleaned the engine. But now it looks good and clean, so much nicer to change piston and stuff when needed to. :) Here is the picture of clean engine: [url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva247218] [img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/myllypestyn_1.JPG[/img][/url]
[u][b]9.10.2007[/b][/u] Didn't have much time so I only cleaned carburator and exhaust. [url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva247735] [img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/kaasari.JPG[/img][/url]
[b][u]10.10.2007[/u][/b] Today I removed headlight, front fender, rear brake, rear suspension, swing, and also prepared exhaust for painting (gonna paint it tomorrow, my dad will weld it little bit at work). Good thing that I removed suspension - it was REALLY dirty and when dissembling it I found out that couple of nuts were missing, and those who weren't missing were really loose. Now I cleaned suspension system, but the spring still needs some cleaning. Tomorrow I will clean spring, some of frame, probably paint the exhaust and maybe something more. :) Depends how much time I got. Here are two pictures: [url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva247678] [img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/jousitus2.JPG[/img][/url][url=http://www.motot.net/galleria/kuva247677][img]http://www.motot.net/galleria/data/23915/thumbs/swingirti.JPG[/img][/url]
[U][B]Next things to do:[/B][/U] -Continue dissembling [s]-Clean the engine...[/s] -Sandpaper the frame -Buy some parts & paint -Paint it.

item.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

Hehe thanks Moparisthebest.

Sorry for not posting pictures or updating, but I will post pics and update in few days. Frame is almost painted now and I’m preparing swing arm for painting (most annoying job… ).

I’ll post pics when they are ready and looking good! :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 27, 2009, 07:41:13 pm[/size][hr]Haha, totally forgot this thread.

Well, the bike is now ready for sell. I would have made even better, but I’m out of money so I have to sell it…

Anyways, here are the before & after pictures:
Before

After

Next project will be Opel Calibra, just need to get new transmission. Already bought new front and rear bumber. I might post a topic about it also.

Tho I’m pretty interested in BMW 325 e30 cabriolet, or Toyta Corolla KE70 for winter… [br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 27, 2009, 07:44:42 pm[/size][hr]Haha, totally forgot this thread.

Well, the bike is now ready for sell. I would have made even better, but I’m out of money so I have to sell it…

Anyways, here are the before & after pictures:
Before

After

Next project will be Opel Calibra, just need to get new transmission. Already bought new front and rear bumber. I might post a topic about it also.

Tho I’m pretty interested in BMW 325 e30 cabriolet, or Toyta Corolla KE70 for winter…

Read full topic

item.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Oh look, somebody else who dosen’t think a bike has to be less than one year old and made of plastic

I love the superdream to be honest, they’re virtually indestructable too, haven’t had to do much to it at all in the 2 years I’ve had it, except straighten it out a bit when it hit the road pretty hard (oops). Getting something bigger as soon as I can afford it though, however much I like it, it is only a 400 twin after all…

item.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

I posted pics of my bike in IRC once, but nobody can appreciate the superdream

I didn’t see them? Honda superdream’s are pretty sweet bikes I think, I almost bought a 1966 Honda Dream, those are truly sweet rides. Currently though I just have an 82 Silverwing.

Looks like you are going about it the right way Secet, I have never restored a bike before but have done (and am doing) a few cars, it’s fun stuff.

item.source: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)

item.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:22, topic:149967”]Nice bike you got there mate, I love them (not as much as my Yamaha R1 though :P).

How much KM’s did the bike make?

Also it might be me, but your drive chain needs some adjusment, maybe some new oil and it have to be retightend.

And for a carburator I would advise you a Mikuni or Keihin 38MM, you might have to change the manifold tho, or use a stuffer in order to have a correct mixture flow with the venturi of the carb.

And whats the state of the clutch and clutch plates, did you check that :P? Like how much spacing is there between gears, and how is clutching, not to lose/thight?[/quote]
I think bike has been ridden for for like 50000 kilometers. Yea I will ofcourse tighten the chain when I start assembling the bike, before I do that I need to paint the frame & swing. It got alot to do, but it will be fine.

38mm Keihin would be too big for original KDX cylinder, but if I get KX cylinder, piston, exhaust and airfilter then it would be fine. But for now, 38mm would be too big. I think…

I didn’t have much time to test the clutch, but it seemed to work pretty well. Gears went nicely on and so on, no extra sounds or anything

Yea R1 probably owns, too bad I have never ridden one I might buy Yamaha R6 (00-03 probably) when I’m old enough to ride it. I’m 16 now, 17 in November, so I still have to wait one summer to ride 600ccs… :S Sucks to be born in november

Today I will hopefully clean & dissemble the carburator (just look at the pictures and you know why ) and after that I will start cleaning the frame.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 09, 2007, 10:27:45 AM[/size][hr]9.10.2007
Didn’t have much time so I only cleaned carburator and exhaust.

Read full topic

item.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:22, topic:149967”]Nice bike you got there mate, I love them (not as much as my Yamaha R1 though :P).

How much KM’s did the bike make?

Also it might be me, but your drive chain needs some adjusment, maybe some new oil and it have to be retightend.

And for a carburator I would advise you a Mikuni or Keihin 38MM, you might have to change the manifold tho, or use a stuffer in order to have a correct mixture flow with the venturi of the carb.

And whats the state of the clutch and clutch plates, did you check that :P? Like how much spacing is there between gears, and how is clutching, not to lose/thight?[/quote]
It’s a 125, geared for the road, It’ll be geared really low.
And, R1’s own.

[quote=“Mopman, post:21, topic:149967”]Lookin’ good, ignore YZ, he’s biased (<3)

I posted pics of my bike in IRC once, but nobody can appreciate the superdream :([/quote]

.<

Also it might be me, but your drive chain needs some adjusment, maybe some new oil and it have to be retightend.

And whats the state of the clutch and clutch plates, did you check that :P? Like how much spacing is there between gears, and how is clutching, not to lose/thight?

item.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

8.10.2007

Today I haven’t done much. I had only one hour to work with my bike (school, had to install some antivirus softwares on my mom’s computer, had to get insurances and etc.) so I only cleaned the engine.
It looks pretty damn nice now. I think I’m gonna polish the “clutch cage” (don’t know the real word for it, but anyways outside the of clutch) because right now it looks pretty ugly
Here is the picture:

Tomorrow my school ends at 12 o’clock so I got plenty of time. If it doesn’t rain much I think I’m going to start cleaning the frame. If it rains, I will probably clean exhaust and some of the coverings. Shouldn’t be too hard.

Read full topic

item.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

Yz85Racer:

Heard of the WR? One of the best off road bikes in the world

WR? Aren’t those alteast 250cc? Because I can legally ride only 125cc bikes that are 11kw

[quote=“i–own–i, post:15, topic:149967”]This is sweet man I have always wanted to something like this also. I have done it with push bikes a few times (like got shit ones and done them up) and I’ve always wanted to do it with a moto and I will probably be doing it with this car I am probably getting Fixing things is so fun.

Good to see this and cant wait to see after you finish it. GL! :)[/quote]
Yea I like fixing and restoring things too. All bikes I have had were very cheap when I bought them, and then I sell them with higher price. Easy money and “free” (of course it takes time and passion to fix it) bike for a while.
I’m really thinking about those supermoto rims and tires… But damn, they cost pretty much and after all I like to ride on sand/mud and in forests…

Read full topic

item.source: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)

item.title: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:8, topic:149967”]Fuck you.

I was asleep. Now time to rant.

  1. The KDX is an okay bike. However I’ve heard bad things about their reliability, being a Yamaha rider, I wouldn’t care.
  2. Remember to premix the oil. Trust me, it isn’t good
  3. Sell it, buy a Yamaha.[/quote]

I think KDX is pretty good because:
-Most of Kawasaki KX engine parts fits KDX engine
-That means if I need more horsepowers all I need to do is buy KX cylinder, KX cylinder head, KX piston with 36mm carburetor and KX exhaust. That would result as about 35 HP from rear wheel…
-Outlook

I think Yamaha has only one enduro bike, DT. I have heard some good things about it and some bad.
Bad things:
-Outlook
-Not very powerful (?)
-Outlook
Good things:
-Cheap spare parts

But anyways, when I get back from school I will start cleaning engine and then post some more pictures.

Read full topic
item.source: I bought new bike, Kawasaki KDX125! :)
